name: Scyther
flavorText: While young, they live together deep in the mountains, training themselves in how to fight with their scythes and move at high speeds.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Scyther and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

name: Rowlet
flavorText: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.

name: Dartrix
flavorText: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Wimpod
flavorText: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.
Ability1Text: During your first turn, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

name: Pheromosa
flavorText: One of the Ultra Beasts. It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.
Attack2Text: If you have only 1 Prize card remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Charmander
flavorText: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Charmeleon
flavorText: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the air temperature to unbearably high levels.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Fire Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Alolan Vulpix
flavorText: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Wooper
flavorText: When the temperature cools in the evening, they emerge from water to seek food along the shore.

name: Quagsire
flavorText: This carefree Pokémon has an easygoing nature. While swimming, it always bumps into boat hulls.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Water Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

name: Froakie
flavorText: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.
Ability1Text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

name: Frogadier
flavorText: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

name: Voltorb
flavorText: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.
Ability1Text: If this Pokémon has any Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Xurkitree
flavorText: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so people think it energizes itself with electricity.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: If you have exactly 3 Prize cards remaining, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Seviper
flavorText: In battle, it uses its bladed tail to counter any Zangoose. It secretes a deadly venom in its tail.
Ability1Text: Put 1 more damage counter on your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon between turns.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Shuppet
flavorText: It loves vengeful emotions and hangs in rows under the eaves of houses where vengeful people live.

name: Inkay
flavorText: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent's will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Malamar
flavorText: It lures prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Psychic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Poipole
flavorText: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is Knocked Out, your opponent can't take any Prize cards for it.

name: Sudowoodo
flavorText: To avoid attack, it mimics a tree. It will run off if splashed with water, which it hates.
Ability1Text: Your opponent can't have more than 4 Benched Pokémon. If they have 5 or more Benched Pokémon, they discard Benched Pokémon until they have 4 Pokémon on the Bench. If more than one effect changes the number of Benched Pokémon allowed, use the smaller number.

name: Riolu
flavorText: It's tough enough to run right through the night, and it's also a hard worker, but it's still just a youngster.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

name: Lucario
flavorText: They can detect the species of a living being—and its emotions—from over half a mile away. They control auras and hunt their prey in packs.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Garchomp in play, you may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Rockruff
flavorText: This Pokémon has lived with people since times long ago. It can sense when its Trainer is in the dumps and will stick close by its Trainer's side.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Buzzwole
flavorText: A mysterious life-form called an Ultra Beast. Witnesses saw it pulverize a dump truck with a single punch.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has exactly 4 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

name: Zorua
flavorText: It changes so it looks like its foe, tricks it, and then uses that opportunity to flee.

name: Guzzlord
flavorText: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.
Attack1Text: If you have exactly 2, 4, or 6 Prize cards remaining, discard the top 10 cards of your deck.

name: Magnemite
flavorText: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it's eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 Metal Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Magneton
flavorText: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

name: Magnezone
flavorText: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin, while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Metal Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

name: Beldum
flavorText: Its cells are all magnets. It uses magnetism to communicate with others of its kind.
Attack1Text: Discard a Metal Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Metang
flavorText: When two Beldum link together, their psychic power is doubled. Their intelligence, however, remains unchanged.
Attack2Text: Discard a Metal Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Celesteela
flavorText: One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.
Attack1Text: If the total of both players' remaining Prize cards is exactly 6, this attack can be used for Metal.

name: Kartana
flavorText: One of the Ultra Beast life-forms, it was observed cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has exactly 6 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Ralts
flavorText: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.
Attack1Text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Kirlia
flavorText: The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.

name: Diancie
flavorText: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Fairy Pokémon.

name: Altaria
flavorText: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.
Ability1Text: Your Dragon Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Gible
flavorText: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Gabite
flavorText: Shiny objects are its passion. It can be found in its cave, scarcely moving, its gaze fixed on the jewels it's amassed or Carbink it has caught.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Garchomp
flavorText: The protuberances on its head serve as sensors. It can even detect distant prey.
Attack1Text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: If you played Cynthia from your hand during this turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

name: Eevee
evolvesTo: Vaporeon, Jolteon, Flareon, Sylveon, Espeon, Umbreon, Leafeon, Glaceon
flavorText: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokémon.
Ability1Text: When you attach a basic Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon that is the same type as that Energy card and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

name: Swablu
flavorText: It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Noibat
flavorText: They live in pitch black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

name: Oranguru
flavorText: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Type: Null
flavorText: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Leafeon-GX
Ability1Text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 50 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.
Attack2Text: For each of your Benched Basic Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Decidueye-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Put 3 cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Golisopod-GX
Attack1Text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Charizard-GX
Attack2Text: Discard 3 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Ho-Oh-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: This Pokémon can't use Phoenix Burn during your next turn.

name: Reshiram-GX
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Fire Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Turtonator-GX
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 8 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Alolan Ninetales-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Articuno-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon. If you do, move any number of Water Energy from your other Pokémon to this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy from both Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Glaceon-GX
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play, in their hand, and in their discard pile have no Abilities, except for Freezing Gaze.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Greninja-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
Attack1Text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.
Attack2Text: This attack does 130 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Electrode-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach 5 Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon, except Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, in any way you like. If you do, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.
Attack2Text: Discard any amount of Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Xurkitree-GX
Ability1Text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have any Special Energy attached to them.
Attack1Text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.
Attack2Text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Add a card you find there to their Prize cards face down. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Mewtwo-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Espeon-GX
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: This attack does 30 more damage times the number of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Banette-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 Pokémon to another Pokémon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Supporter card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 100 damage in this way.
Attack2Text: Put 3 cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Nihilego-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may leave both Active Pokémon Confused and Poisoned.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Add the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck to their Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Naganadel-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Ultra Beasts in play.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Lucario-GX
Attack1Text: If this Pokémon evolved from Riolu during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Zygarde-GX
Attack1Text: Attach 2 Fighting Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

name: Lycanroc-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Lycanroc-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 30 damage for each Energy card in your opponent's discard pile. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Buzzwole-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

name: Umbreon-GX
Attack1Text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Darkrai-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put it onto your Bench. Then, attach a Darkness Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, that Pokémon is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Guzzlord-GX
Attack1Text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

name: Scizor-GX
Ability1Text: If this Pokémon's remaining HP is 100 or less, its attacks do 80 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 100 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Kartana-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
Attack1Text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.
Attack2Text: Take a Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Stakataka-GX
Ability1Text: Your Ultra Beasts take 10 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Prize card you have taken. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Gardevoir-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fairy Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Shuffle 10 cards from your discard pile into your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Sylveon-GX
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Altaria-GX
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Noivern-GX
Attack1Text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from their hand during their next turn.
Attack2Text: Your opponent can't play any Special Energy cards from their hand during their next turn.

name: Silvally-GX
Ability1Text: Your Basic Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost.
Attack1Text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Drampa-GX
Attack1Text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Tapu Bulu-GX
Attack2Text: You may discard all Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Tapu Fini-GX
Attack1Text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Water Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Tapu Koko-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may move any number of Lightning Energy from your other Pokémon to this Pokémon. If you do, switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Tapu Lele-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.
Attack2Text: Heal all damage from 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
